page.title: 13The River Nith in Dumfries
page.content: The{River Nith}rises in the{Doon {Valley}area in South-West Scotland and flows down past{Kirkconnel}then {Sanquar}then{Thornhill}and through the middle of{Dumfries}to flow out into the{Solway Firth.}In Dumfries the Nith flows along the{Whitesands.}There are mostly shops at the 'Sands', and since it floods a lot they find it difficult to take out an insurance policy, because the insurance company would be paying out too much money for repairs. There is a road and a parking space, (including a space for a bus company), between the Nith and the shops. There are four bridges across the Nith. The first is called the{Buccleuch St {Bridge,}the second is the{Devorgilla {Bridge,}the third is the{Suspension {Bridge}and the last is St.Michael's {Bridge.}The only traffic bridges are the first and fourth.
